The DBD and DBD + 154-257 derivatives of C/EBP? were constructed by replacing, respectively, the amino terminal 257 amino acids of C/EBP?-GFP (to the SgrAI site of C/EBP?) and the amino terminal 153 amino acids of C/EBP?-GFP (to the NotI site of C/EBP?) with oligonucleotides containing a strong Kozak sequence.

In some differentiating cell types, changes in both gene transcription and proliferation are regulated by the same transcription factor [ 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 ] . CCAAT/Enhancer Binding Protein alpha (C/EBP?) is a transcription factor that is required for the differentiation of a number of tissues [ 10 11 12 13 14 15 16 17 18 ] . Mice homozygous for C/EBP? null alleles have severe defects in tissues involved in metabolic homeostasis [ 19 20 21 ] . Cellular proliferation is elevated in the liver of these knockout mice [ 22 ] suggesting that C/EBP? blocks proliferation in vivo.
We next synchronized GHFT1-5 cells in particular stages of the cell cycle.
However, the amino terminus of C/EBP? also functionally interacts with a number of other factors [ 31 45 46 ] , any of which might contribute to proliferation arrest.

Possible mechanisms of transcription-independent proliferation arrest by C/EBP? have been suggested by a number of studies.

The fused cDNA was cloned into a previously described expression vector [ 58 ] . The GFP and C/EBP? portions of the fusion were separated by a 16 amino acid long linker including the epitope for the FLAG antibody.
